oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photoluminescence study of polycrystalline and single crystal diamond
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MOHAPATRA, DIPTI R
RAI, PADMNABH
MISRA, ABHA
TYAGI, PK
MISRA, DS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: diamond
photoluminescence
plasma cvd
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Employing photoluminescence (PL) spectroscopy, we have carried out a detailed study of the different luminescence center in chemical-vapor- deposited (CVD) single-crystal and poly-crystalline diamond and natural diamonds. In addition to the zero phonon line, the fine structure of the PL emission spectra reveals vibronic bands corresponding to both phonon emission and absorption. At lower temperature, the emission intensity increases and peak position shifts towards higher energy band.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the IEEE International Workshop on Physics of Semiconductor Devices, Mumbai, India, 16-20 December 2007, 891 - 893
